reg:regulation.reg:acttitle: Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act
reg:regulation.reg:title: Drug Schedules Regulation

bcl:subsection.bcl:text: The drug schedules are printed in an alphabetical format to simplify the process of locating each individual drug entry and determining its status in British Columbia.
Each entry is preceded by a code noted as 1, 1A, 2 or 3, in which
Drugs listed in Schedules I, IA, II and III must be sold from licensed pharmacies.
Unscheduled drugs may be sold from non-pharmacy outlets.
The various schedules are differentiated as follows:

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Schedule I (Prescription): Schedule I drugs require a prescription for sale and are provided to the public by a pharmacist following the diagnosis and professional intervention of a practitioner. The sale is controlled in a regulated environment as defined by provincial pharmacy legislation. Entries followed by a "V" superscript may be sold without having received a prescription if

bcl:subparagraph.bcl:text: the drug is in a form not suitable for human use, or

the main panel of the manufacturer's inner label and the manufacturer's outer label carry, in both official languages, the statement "For Veterinary Use Only" or "For Agricultural Use Only" immediately following or preceding the brand name, proper name or common name, in type size not less than one-half as large as the largest type on the label, and the product is sold in the original manufacturer's container.

bcl:paragraph.bcl:text: Schedule IA (Triplicate/Duplicate Prescription Program): Drugs which may be sold by a pharmacist to a practitioner or on the prescription of a practitioner in accordance with the bylaws to the Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act.

Schedule II (Professional Service Area): Drugs which may be sold by a pharmacist on a non-prescription basis and which must be retained within the Professional Service Area of the pharmacy where there is no public access and no opportunity for patient self-selection.
Schedule III (Professional Products Area): Drugs which may be sold by a pharmacist to any person from the self-selection Professional Products Area of a licensed pharmacy.
Unscheduled (Non-pharmacy Sale): Drugs which may be sold by a non-pharmacist to any person.

oasis:entry.oasis:line: Acetaminophen, when recommended for administration by intravenous injection
Acetaminophen (in sustained-release formulations containing greater than 650 mg per unit or in package sizes greater than 50 units)

Adrenocortical hormones and their salts and derivativesV, including but not limited to betamethasone dipropionate, betamethasone phosphate, betamethasone sodium, betamethasone valerate, budesonide, ciclesonide, clobetasone, cortisone, dexamethasone acetate, dexamethasone phosphate, dexamethasone sodium, difluprednate, fludrocortisone acetate, flunisolide, fluticasone furoate, fluticasone propionate, hydrocortisone aceponate, hydrocortisone acetate, hydrocortisone sodium, methylprednisolone acetate, methylprednisolone, methylprednisolone sodium, methylprednisolone succinate, mometasone furoate, prednisolone acetate, prednisolone phosphate, prednisolone sodium, prednisone, triamcinolone acetonide, triamcinolone hexacetonide (except
(a) hydrocortisone or hydrocortisone acetate, when sold as a single medicinal ingredient in a concentration that provides 1% or less hydrocortisone in preparations for topical use on the skin,
(b) hydrocortisone or hydrocortisone acetate, when sold in combination with any other non-prescription medicinal ingredient that provides 1% or less hydrocortisone in preparations for topical use on the skin,
(c) clobetasone butyrate, when sold in a concentration of 0.05% in cream preparations for topical use on the skin,
(d) fluticasone propionate, when sold for the treatment of allergic rhinitis in a nasal spray that delivers 50 mcg per metered spray for individuals 18 years of age and older),
(e) mometasone furoate for the treatment of allergic rhinitis in a nasal spray that delivers 50 mcg per spray for those 12 years of age and older, and
(f) triamcinolone acetonide in a nasal spray that delivers 55 mcg per spray for adults and children 12 years of age and older

Ronidazole and its salts and derivativesV

Salicylic acid (when sold in topical formulations containing salicylic acid at concentrations greater than 20% or with a pH less than 3.0, or both, except when sold to be applied to warts, corns or calluses)
Salsalate and its salts and derivatives
Saquinavir and its salts and derivatives
Selenium in injectable form for parenteral nutrition

Sex hormonesV (the exemption from requiring a prescription if sold for veterinary use does not apply to those listed separately elsewhere in this schedule and those listed in the drug schedules associated with the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act (Canada), except those contained in an agricultural implant)
Sodium acetate in injectable form for parenteral nutrition
Sodium chloride in injectable form for parenteral nutrition
Sodium chloride, single ingredient solutions for injectable use in concentrations of more than 0.9%
Sodium fluoride (in solid oral dosage forms containing more than one milligram of fluoride ion)V
Sodium iodide in injectable form, when used as a sclerosing agent
Sodium iodine in injectable form for parenteral nutrition
Sodium phosphate in injectable form for parenteral nutrition
Sodium picosulphate for oral purgatives, 10 mg per pack (when found in preparations with magnesium oxide 3.5 g and citric acid 12 g)
Spectinomycin and its salts and derivativesV
Spiramycin and its salts and derivativesV
Streptomycin and its salts and derivativesV
Strontium and its salts in injectable form (except strontium bromide)
Succinimide and its salts and derivatives (except those compounds used for decontaminating water)
Sulphonamides and their salts and derivativesV

Synthetic cannabinoid receptor type-1 agonists, their salts, derivatives, isomers, and salts of derivatives and isomers, as listed in the schedules associated with the Controlled Drugs and Substances Act (Canada) and the Narcotic Control Regulations (Canada)
Tazobactam and its salts and derivatives
Telithromycin and its salts and derivatives
Telmisartan and its salts and derivatives
Tenecteplase and its salts and derivatives
Tenofovir and its salts and derivatives
Tetracaine and its salts (for ophthalmic or parenteral use)
Tetracaine and its salts (for topical use on mucous membranes, except lozenges)
Tetracaine (when in a preparation containing an equal amount of lidocaine and recommended for topical use on the skin, in concentrations of 7% or higher)

Tetracycline and its salts and derivativesV (the exemption from requiring a prescription if sold for veterinary use does not apply if sold as doxycycline for intramuscular administration in caged birds)
Tetrahydrozoline (in nasal preparations for pediatric use)
Ticarcillin and its salts and derivatives
Tioconazole and its salts (except in preparations for topical or intra-vaginal use in humans)V
Tioconazole and its salts (in preparations for intra-vaginal use)
Tirofiban and its salts and derivatives
Tobramycin and its salts and derivatives
Tolfenamic acid and its salts and derivatives
Trandolaprilat and its salts and derivatives
Tretinoin and its salts and derivatives
Triamcinolone acetonide in an aqueous nasal spray that delivers 55 mcg per metered spray for adults and children 12 years of age and older, in package sizes containing more than 120 metered sprays
Triamcinolone acetonide in an aqueous nasal spray that delivers 55 mcg per metered spray for adults and children 12 years of age and older, in package sizes containing no more than 120 metered sprays
Tropicamide and its salts (in preparations for parenteral or ophthalmic use, except when sold for use in diagnostic procedures to an optometrist registered in a province of Canada)
Trovafloxacin and its salts and derivatives
Tylosin and its salts and derivatives (when sold for the treatment of chronic colitis in dogs)
Tylosin and its salts and derivativesV (except when sold for the treatment of chronic colitis in dogs)
Ulipristal or its salts or derivatives (including but not limited to ulipristal acetate)
Unoprostone and its salts and derivatives
Uracil and its salts, when sold for the treatment of cancer
Urea (in topical preparations in concentrations of more than 25%)

VaccinesV (except influenza, vaccines which are part of a routine immunization program, those requiring special enhanced public access due to disease outbreaks and cholera vaccine (oral, inactivated) when used for prophylaxis against traveler's diarrhea due to enterotoxigenic escherichia coli (ETEC))

Vaccines (influenza, vaccines which are part of a routine immunization program, those requiring special enhanced public access due to disease outbreaks and cholera vaccine (oral, inactivated) when used for prophylaxis against traveler's diarrhea due to enterotoxigenic escherichia coli (ETEC))
Valganciclovir and its salts and derivatives
Valsartan and its salts and derivatives
Vancomycin and its salts and derivatives
Vedaprofen and its salts and derivatives
Vegetable tar (except shampoos in concentrations of 5% or less)
Veratrum album and its alkaloids and their saltsV
Veratrum viride and its alkaloids and their saltsV
Verteporfin and its salts and derivatives
Vigabatrin and its salts and derivatives
Viomycin and its salts and derivatives
Virginiamycin and its salts and derivativesV

Vitamin A in oral dosage form containing more than 10 000 International Units of Vitamin A per dosage form or, where the largest recommended daily dosage shown on the label would, if consumed by a person, result in the daily intake by that person of more than 10 000 International Units of Vitamin A
Vitamin B12 with Intrinsic Factor Concentrate

Vitamin D in oral dosage form containing more than 62.5 mcg or 2 500 International Units of Vitamin D per dosage form or, where the largest recommended daily dosage shown on the label would, if consumed by a person, result in the daily intake by that person of more than 62.5 mcg or 2 500 International Units of Vitamin D

Vitamin KV (except Vitamin K1 and Vitamin K2 sold
(a) for external use in humans, or
(b) in an oral dosage form for use in humans if the maximum recommended daily dose is 0.120 mg or less)
Vitamins in injectable form, except those listed in Schedule I
Vitamins in injectable form for parenteral nutrition
Xylometazoline and its salts (in nasal preparations for pediatric use)
Zanamivir and its salts and derivatives
Zinc chloride in injectable form for parenteral nutrition
Zinc sulfate in injectable form for parenteral nutrition
Zoledronic acid and its salts and derivatives
Zuclopenthixol and its salts and derivatives

bcl:footnote.bcl:text: Prescription not required if sold for veterinary use, provided that the product is labelled by the manufacturer "for agricultural use only" or "for veterinary use only."

reg:content.reg:provisionsnote: [Provisions relevant to the enactment of this regulation: Pharmacy Operations and Drug Scheduling Act, S.B.C. 2003, c. 77, ss. 22 and 23 (4).]
